questions.question: What is the role of the weights in the dead weight gauge calibrator?

answers.a: They determine the pressure range of the calibrator
answers.b: They stabilize the calibrator during the calibration process
answers.c: They apply a known pressure to the oil
answers.d: They measure the weight of the plunger

questions.question: Which factor is not considered during the calibration process?

answers.b: Wear and tear of the pressure gauge
answers.c: Humidity level in the calibration environment
answers.d: Mechanical stress on the pressure gauge

questions.question: Which data should be recorded during the calibration process?

answers.a: The weight of the plunger and the diameter of the stem
answers.b: The number of weights placed on the plunger
answers.c: The brand and model of the pressure gauge being calibrated
answers.d: The length of the connecting hoses used

questions.question: During calibration, the pressure gauge reading is 200 kilopascals. The actual pressure calculated using the known weights and the plunger's cross-sectional area is 205 kilopascals. What is the percentage error in the pressure gauge reading?
If a weight of 20 Newtons is placed on the platform and the cross-sectional area of the plunger is 0.03 m2, what is the pressure applied by the dead weight gauge calibrator?
